snippet: After Gov. Terry McAuliffe lost his battle with the legislature over Medicaid expansion, he is thought to be studying how to press the issue by executive action — a legally and politically uncertain course.
abstract: Virginia Gov Terry McAuliffe loses his battle with state lawmakers over Medicaid expansion, an enormous retreat from the high expectations he set for a liberal agenda; he is thought to be studying how to press the issue by executive action, a legally and politically uncertain course; facing a June 30 deadline to pass a state budget, Democrats gave in to Republican demands to leave out a Medicaid expansion.
lead_paragraph: After Gov. Terry McAuliffe lost his battle with the legislature over Medicaid expansion, he is thought to be studying how to press the issue by executive action — a legally and politically uncertain course.

headline.main: Virginia Governor May Try to Expand Medicaid on His Own
headline.print_headline: Virginia Governor May Try to Expand Medicaid on His Own

keywords.value: Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (2010)
